Posts.Content: Oops, I'm so very sorry about your mom. I'm not going to lie to you, it's going to be really rough on all of you. The chemo has an accumulative effect. Make sure she takes all her meds appropriately. The thrush can be treated. One thing you need to know is take nothing for granted. Double check everything, Google everything for answers. Example; my husband got severe blood clots due to both the cancer and the chemo. I give him two shots of Lovenox in the abdomen, one in the am and the other in the pm. The shots hurt, although the RN told me they didn't. I asked her if she'd ever had any, she said no. Told her how the hell would she know. I couldn't imagine giving him a painful shot twice a day. I googled it. Come to find out, there is a prescription for lidocaine that will numb the area. The info on the internet said to put a dime size spot, cover it with press and seal for an hour, wash it off and his skin is numb. No one in the ER told me about that, I had to find out for myself. There are a ton of side effects from the chemo, really keep on top of every ache and pain. Keep a go-to tote with everything you need for a speedy trip to the ER or doctor. Keep a list of all your doctor's and their emergency numbers. If your mom ends up in the ER ALWAYS double check with her oncologist. The ER doctor was going to prescribe the wrong blood thinner for my husband. Lastly, get yourself some antidepressants, you can't help your mom if you fall apart. Join every support group you can find, they have some great ones on Facebook. Take care of yourself, it's going to be hard. I'm 62, I have promised my adult kids and my husband that I will be ok. Where is your mom getting treatment? Sue
Posts.Title: Coping with my moms chemo for breast cancer
Coping with my moms chemo for breast cancer

Posts.Content: The chemo has a lot of side effects, could have been a number of things, sometimes it happens quickly.
Posts.Title: MY FRIEND DIED ON SUNDAY IM LOST.

Posts.Content: I'm very sorry. One day at a time. Love her, spend time with her, make memories. The time frame is not up to us. One thing I would say. I post my father in law to cancer. We were not his primary care givers another family member was. His pain wasn't managed appropriately in the beginning because his caregiver was clueless. We had to go to his doctor. Please don't do that to your mother in law. Be aggressive with pain management.
Posts.Title: mother in law bad diagnosis

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry about your mom. You didn't give too much information regarding her circumstances, but my first thought was dementia. That's how it starts, a change in temperament and mood swings. My husband has cancer and i have joined a few support pages on Facebook. Surprisingly, for some of those people, the cancer diagnosis for their loved ones has increased the decline with their dementia. In some cases where they didn't have symptoms of dementia before cancer diagnosis they were presented with a rapid diagnosis with a sharp decline after. Does your mom take an antidepressant? That might really help. Good luck sue
Posts.Title: Mental disorder post treatment of Breast cancer

Posts.Content: Oops, did she get a second opinion? I would be as aggressive as possible.
Posts.Title: TRIPLE POSITIVE BREAST CANCER

Posts.Content: I really hope your mom improves. It's really a lot to deal with, I know you love your mom, I can hear it in your comments. Good luck. Sue
Posts.Title: Mental disorder post treatment of Breast cancer

Posts.Content: Prayers for you Nancy, cyber hugs in abundance.
Posts.Title: Metastatic Breast Cancer to the Bones
Vaginal Symptoms from Treatment - Stanford Research Survey

Posts.Content: I am so as sorry about your friend. I don't have any wise words of wisdom. Love her, hug her, love her some more, make sure she's not alone. Prayers for both of you. Sue
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: MD Anderson is a huge complex in Texas, Houston I believe. It is rated #1 for treating cancer.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: I would absolutely not screw around with this. The ultrasound will show more detail and go deeper. You need a biopsy or lumpectomy. I would follow up immediately to determine what's going on. You are in charge of your health, not the doctor. If it's nothing, be sure it's nothing and celebrate. I do have a question, did they tell you at the last mammogram that there was a mass? Ultrasound and CT will show a lot more detail than a mammogram.
Posts.Title: breast mass

Posts.Content: I'm really sorry about your mom. I have no idea what you should do. You would have to have her legal rights taken away. I'm not sure forcing her would be in her best interest at this point. Its really hard to deal with the mental illness, the cancer is bad enough. I have a friend whose mother has dementia and has cancer. It's difficult. By the time they commit her, the cancer would have progressed. Good luck.
Posts.Title: mom in denial

Posts.Content: I would absolutely get the biopsy. I think waiting is a terrible idea.
Posts.Title: Breast Lump

Posts.Content: My thoughts, get another opinion, compare the two. I would be really aggressive. Prayers for you
Posts.Title: decisions

Posts.Content: I'm really sorry about the position you find yourself and your family. I'm a type A but it's my husband who has cancer. I was smart enough to know myself. I trotted myself into my doctors office and asked for an antidepressant. Has anyone suggested that to you? Maybe not, she wouldn't take it well if it wasn't her idea. I'm really not sure what the answer is. Cancer effects everyone differently. Good luck
Posts.Title: Extreme anger / breast cancer

Posts.Content: Sandy, that's a really good idea. You can tell her if one person in the family has cancer the whole family has cancer. She's not in this alone, it's the whole family that suffers. They just all suffer in different ways.
Posts.Title: Extreme anger / breast cancer

Posts.Content: I'm sorry about your mom. It sounds like they didn't do their job. I understand why she didn't have chemo but she should have. It's unknown if chemo would have stopped it. The cancer cells are tiny and spread insidiously but that spread awful fast. I'm really sorry for everything you've gone through.
